course_title: Topics In Women's Literature: Native American Women's Lit.
class_notes: (This course will focus primarily on recent writing - fiction, non-fiction, poetry, and drama - by American Indian women: Joy Harjo, Louise Erdrich, Mary Kathryn Nagle, Layli Long Soldier, Natalie Diaz, Cynthia Leitich Smith, and others. We will read these texts in relation to historical texts and contexts as well as contemporary concerns. We will also regularly engage Native news media sources. How are Indigenous women's bodies sites of colonization, assimilation, and appropriation but also sites of resistance, healing, and empowerment? How do Native women writers deploy a diverse array of literary styles and techniques? And what can we all learn by centering the experiences and voices of Native American women?)
course_description: Topics and perspectives vary over successive offerings, such as the political novel and feminist poetics. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
sections: Class Nbr: 2726, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 9:40-10:55a, Instructor: M. Suhr-Sytsma, Status: Open
